Description: Bust of Napoleon Bonaparte, left, with long hair, in embroidered military uniform, with epaulettes. (obverse)
Inscription in four lines, within a wreath of laurel. (reverse)
Curator's comments: According to Hennin's catalogue, this medal was struck sometime between the signing of the treaty of Campo Formio, 17 Oct 1797 and Napoleon's departure to Egypt, 18 May 1798.
Bibliographic references: Hennin 1826 / Histoire Numismatique De La Révolution Française (836, p.584)
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
